citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A Long Earred Hedgehog named "Meep" born 1/5/23 has dried up crusty looking ears. In addition the skin tissue looks to
be slightly swollen. The licensee has observed the condition, but has not contacted the Attending Veterinarian. Not
seeking treatment from the Attending Veterinarian for this condition doesn't ensure the animal is receiving proper medical
treatment for the condition that is present. The ears could worsen, become infected, and may cause irritation to the
animal. The licensee must contact the Attending Veterinarian and follow the treatment plan developed by the Attending
Veterinarian. Correct by 9/19/23.

46 hedgehogs and 2 Long Earred Hedgehogs were not documented in the acquisition records. Not documenting all the
intake information of all the animals on site does not allow for proper tracking by an APHIS official. All regulated animals
must have all intake information properly documented. Correct by 10/18/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A Long Earred Hedgehog named "Meep" born 1/5/23 has dried up crusty looking ears. In addition the skin tissue looks to 
be slightly swollen. The licensee has observed the condition, but has not contacted the Attending Veterinarian. Not 
seeking treatment from the Attending Veterinarian for this condition doesn't ensure the animal is receiving proper medical 
treatment for the condition that is present. The ears could worsen, become infected, and may cause irritation to the 
animal. The licensee must contact the Attending Veterinarian and follow the treatment plan developed by the Attending 
Veterinarian. Correct by 9/19/23. 
2.75(b)(1)(i) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
46 hedgehogs and 2 Long Earred Hedgehogs were not documented in the acquisition records. Not documenting all the 
intake information of all the animals on site does not allow for proper tracking by an APHIS official. All regulated animals 
must have all intake information properly documented. Correct by 10/18/23. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report.
